content.value: Awakened with an unknown past, Rover embarks on a journey to uncover the truths. As secrets are unveiled, Rover establishes deeper connections with the world.

Rover performs attacks forward, dealing ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"value":"Spectro DMG","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" considered as Resonance Skill DMG.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Diminutive Sound","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-5"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rover can hold up to 100 \"Diminutive Sounds\". review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rover is the main character in Wuthering Waves","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", starting as a Spectro-based Hybrid character who is a jack-of-all-trades, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"splitting their focus between dealing damage and controlling the battlefield","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". In the future, you can expect other elemental variants of the Rover that use different Weapons to be released, similar to other games in the genre, but for now, you will be stuck with the Spectro variant, so let's dig into what they offer. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rover tries to do many things at once and while they can perform adequately well in all of them, they aren’t top of their role at anything","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - which early on isn't that big of a downside but as you obtain more characters, you will most likely want to switch to them due their more specialized roles. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rover's damage is some of the highest of any hybrid character without considering coordinated attacks","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", partially thanks to their high base stats, and the fact you get all their sequences for free (many of which are damage boosts). In the CBT2 they were often played with damage-focused builds capitalizing on their fast and precise attack frames that allow for effective parrying against endgame bosses. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"On top of the damage, Rover's Outro brings great utility thanks to the time-stop bubble, allowing you to control enemies, opening up an easier time to dodge attacks or pummel the enemy with a combo without worrying about missing. While this controlling effect is unique and strong it does mean Rovers don't offer a Deepen damage bonus, making them less valuable in teams focusing on going all in on a main damage character. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"you unlock Rover's Sequences for free","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", which doubles down on Rovers jack of all trades nature opening up new playstyles and also buffing capabilities. After unlocking them all, they gain the ability to heal the team (at S4) and a unique Spectro RES shred against enemies hit by their skill (at S6) all on top of course more damage capabilities. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rover's a great free character who is easy to learn and can be played in ways with a variety of builds","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", allowing them to 'fill in' for whatever you're missing - especially considering that for the endgame, you need 3 teams, in 1.0 you’ll likely always find a use for them. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Boasts a good combination of damage and utility,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can quickly fill their Forte Gauge,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All Sequences are available for free,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fast and precise attack frames that make parrying easier,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High utility outro, opening enemies for an easy combo or a quick escape.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While early on, they will feel really strong due to the free Sequences, the rest of the cast will catch up once you start getting theirs,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While the damage output is really good, it still lags behind the dedicated main DPS, and at the same time, their Outro is a CC effect, not a buff, making it hard to find a place for them in most endgame best-in-slot compositions.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

voiceActors.kr: Song Ha Rim /  Kim Sin Woo
